summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's third bail application. The AUSA is seeking input on arguments for opposing the application, noting Maxwell's pending appeal to the Second Circuit after her second bail denial by Judge Alison Nathan.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email; she has filed a third bail application after her second was denied and she appealed that denial to the Second Circuit.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge who denied Ghislaine Maxwell's second bail application, leading to her appeal.

connections.description: Judge Nathan presided over Maxwell's case and denied her second bail application, which Maxwell then appealed.
M, an AUSA, is representing the government in opposing Maxwell's bail applications.

events.title: Maxwell Files Third Bail Application
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell filed her third application for bail.

events.title: Denial of Second Bail Application
events.description: Judge Alison Nathan denied Ghislaine Maxwell's second bail application.

events.title: Notice of Appeal Filed
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell filed a notice of appeal to the Second Circuit Court of Appeals following the denial of her second bail application.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell filed a third bail application in late February 2021.
Her second bail application had previously been denied by Judge Alison Nathan.
Following the second denial, Maxwell filed a notice of appeal to the Second Circuit Court of Appeals but had not yet filed briefing as of this email.
The U.S. Attorney's Office was planning to oppose the third bail application and was considering jurisdictional arguments related to the pending appeal.
The email highlights a legal 'fuzzy area' regarding whether a pending appeal divests the district court of jurisdiction to hear a subsequent bail application.
